UI_visible_response: To determine how many people died during the Long March, we can use the survival statistics provided in the sources.According to one source, out of 100,000 people who began the Long March, only 8,000 survived1. This means that approximately 92,000 people died during the trek.Another source corroborates this figure, stating that "only one in 10 survived," which aligns with the 8,000 survivors mentioned earlier5. This again suggests a death toll of around 92,000 people .Thus, based on the available information, it is estimated that approximately 92,000 people died during the Long March .
traffic_visible_response: To determine how many people died during the Long March, we can use the survival statistics provided in the sources. According to one source, out of 100,000 people who began the Long March, only 8,000 survived [[1]]. This means that approximately **92,000 people died** during the trek.Another source corroborates this figure, stating that "only one in 10 survived," which aligns with the 8,000 survivors mentioned earlier [[5]]. This again suggests a death toll of around **92,000 people**.Thus, based on the available information, it is estimated that **approximately 92,000 people died during the Long March**.
